title: Oatlands Railway
text:
The Oatlands Railway was a short <a href="Spur%20line">branch</a> of the <a href="South%20Line%2C%20Tasmania">Main Line</a> from <a href="Launceston%2C%20Tasmania">Launceston</a> to <a href="Hobart">Hobart</a> in <a href="Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, which was built to give rail access to the town of <a href="Oatlands%2C%20Tasmania">Oatlands</a>. The railway opened on 13 May 1885 and it closed on 10 June 1949.
The line branched off of the Main Line in <a href="Parattah%2C%20Tasmania">Parattah</a> outside the Tudor style Parattah Hotel and followed parallel to the Main Line for approximately before branching off in a north west direction towards <a href="Lake%20Dulverton">Lake Dulverton</a>. From there, the railway followed the lake's shoreline before turning in on Wellington Street and ending where it intersects with High Street. The original station building is now used as a child care centre. Much of the former route is now used as a bike trail, a section of it is clearly visible as a terrace like formation at Mahers Point and part of an embankment and small bridge runs alongside the road to Parattah, where it crosses Parattah Creek. The locomotive "<a href="Big%20Ben%20%28locomotive%29">Big Ben</a>" used to operate the line from 1948 until the line closed a year later in 1949.
